alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 7:05AM EDT until April 09 at 11:37AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... West Branch Delaware At Walton affecting Delaware County. For the West Branch Delaware River...including Walton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Branch Delaware At Walton. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Water begins to break out of the river channel and floods low spots along Delaware Street in Walton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EDT Friday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
